text:
After setting up the appropriate environment variables, I run the tomcat.bat 
file
I get the messages:
Including all jars in K:\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.1\lib in your CLASSPATH
J:\W3\Java\jdk1.2.2\src.jar was unexpected at this time.

I basically debugged the batch file and the "" are not needed around the 
%CLASSPATH% in the following if statement.
if "%CLASSPATH%" == "" goto noClasspath
creator: jt362@nyu.edu

text:
The quotes around %CLASSPATH% are needed.  This is a basic DOS scripting 
thing.  If the CLASSPATH environment variable is empty then the statement in 
question would end up as a syntax error becuase it would look like

if   == "" goto noClasspath

Check your CLASSPATH environment variable and make sure it doesn't contain any 
double quotes.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
